intro: Wamalchitamia strigosa, commonly known as the rough-stemmed wamalchitamia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its hairy, rough-textured stems and broad, heart-shaped leaves. It produces showy, five-petaled flowers in shades of pink and white, typically blooming during the wet season. Wamalchitamia strigosa is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and along riverbanks.
